result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly M Green was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Court waived the DNA surcharge as a DNA sample was not taken. Cash bail on deposit to apply. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
Obtain and maintain employment or take care of child.

Successfully complete a parenting class.
Get involved in a Mommy and Me (or something similar) class.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kimberly M Green

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kimberly M Green in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.
Bail Refund Check Packet

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Defendant sentenced to serve 8 months in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 9/25/15.
-Successfully complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-Get involved in a Mommy and Me (or something similar) class.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Court waived the DNA surcharge as a DNA sample was not taken.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment or take care of child.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.

Defendant Kimberly M Green in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Defense motion to dismiss based upon defefective complaint heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court denied the motion.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  
Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  The case is adjourned to Branch 40 for a Pretrial Conference.
